traits.beloved_friend: Introduced as the one whom Jesus loves, brother of Mary and Martha of Bethany.
traits.illness_and_death: Falls ill and dies after Jesus delays coming, setting the stage for a sign revealing Jesus as the resurrection and the life.
traits.raising_from_the_dead: Called out of the tomb by Jesus after four days, still bound in grave clothes, providing a climactic sign in the Gospel.
traits.impact_on_belief_and_opposition: His raising leads many Jews to believe in Jesus but also provokes the chief priests and Pharisees to plot against Jesus and later to plan to kill Lazarus as well.
traits.presence_at_banquet: Reclines at table with Jesus in Bethany when Mary anoints Jesus’s feet, serving as a living sign of Jesus’s power over death.
